text: In this tutorial,

we're going to show you how
to shoot a TikTok video,
how to add sound and effects,
create duet and reaction videos,
and how to post your video.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
parts of this tutorial.
To create a TikTok video,

press on the plus-sign
icon in the menu bar.
Doing so will open up your camera

and all of the features available
to use within your video.

Tap and hold the big red button
to start recording video.
Release when you've finished your clip.

TikTok videos can go up to
three minutes in length.
You can slow down or speed up your video,

add effects, and record and
stitch together multiple clips.

Tap "Sounds" here to
add music to your video.
TikTok has a vast library to find music.

Click on the track you
want to add to your video.

Tap the volume tab here to
adjust the volume of your music
and original audio.
Once you create your video,

there are even more
effects at your disposal.
You can trim your video as you want,

add transition effects
for between video clips,
and add stickers and text.

In order to create a
duet or reaction video,

click on the arrow that
appears on any TikTok video.

If the user has enabled
duets and reaction videos,

you'll find the options
in the menu that pops up.

Duet allows users to add
to already existing videos
and add their own commentary and effects.

When you finish making
your video, tap "Next."
Give your video a description here.
You can add hashtags and friend mentions

and also choose whether you
want the post to be public,
private, or visible to friends only.
Tap "Post" to publish your video.
